column4: I personally have a radeon and it works perfectly fine... no extra drivers needed.
What FPS do you get when running most of the screen savers?
That is funny... my Radeon 9200 runs all the screensavers around 40-45FPS.
What radeon you got borgista?
glxgears reports around 1,500fps on average for my Radeon 9200... pretty nice.
Did you find a prebuilt driver for Ubuntu stu?
I'll install fglrx, see if I get even better acceleration than I already am.
meh. Don't know. I just config my monitor refresh rate from the gnome settings.
sure... if its present... else, see my last comment
*cough* nano *cough*
most distro's just make pico a symlink to nano for old-timers
pico is closed source... nano is a gnu project...
it is irritating to your pupils though, even if you can't see it... I guess if you don't get headaches though, its all good  :/
even NTFS isn't _that_ bad...
they do work with it (merging things from the other journeled fs's in the kernel etc) regularly...
I believe it first was seen during 2.3 devel cycle though...
yes
you have no ego? You must cease to exist before you can contain no ego.
I have pride... not an ego... I do not believe I am better or worse than anyone.
I never said that you did. We all have pride or ego... tis the nature of humanity.
